subject: Physical Fitness
title: Alcohol and Fitness
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Alcohol and Fitness.

hook.text: A beer after the game seems harmless. But alcohol touches nearly every recovery process â€” and not in a good way.

buildup.text: Alcohol impairs muscle protein synthesis by up to 37%. It disrupts sleep architecture and dehydrates.

discovery.text: It suppresses growth hormone and testosterone â€” the two hormones most important for recovery and adaptation.

twist.text: Even moderate drinking on rest days can impair next-day training quality through disrupted sleep cycles.

climax.text: Occasional light drinking has minimal impact. But regular or heavy intake measurably slows fitness progress.

punchline.text: Alcohol doesn't destroy fitness. But it quietly slows every part of recovery.
